docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 17 -Americans spent over $75-billion on their health care in the fiscal year 1971 at a rate of increase that was double that of both the cost of living and the gross national product.

headline.main: U.S. HEALTH BILL $75-BILLION IN '71; Average Cost Per Person $358 for the Fiscal Year

docs.abstract: Soc Security Adm rept reveals '71 US expenditure for health care was $75-billion, double rate of increase in cost of living and GNP; avg Amer health bill was $358; statistics, which include total cost of health goods and services, add documentation to rising complaints by experts and private citizens that health care costs are out of control in part because of increased demand for med care; various expenditures described
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 17 -Americans spent over $75-billion on their health care in the fiscal year 1971 at a rate of increase that was double that of both the cost of living and the gross national product.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONSSpecial to The New York Times

headline.main: An M.D. Reviews Dr. Welby of TV; Dr. Welby of TV

docs.abstract: Dr M J Halberstam article on Marcus Welby MD TV show discusses show from viewpoint of dr; also discusses other past and present med shows; illus; cartoon
